turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Door into Summer.
turn.1: What is The Door into Summer?
turn.2: The Door into Summer The Door into Summer is a science fiction novel by American writer Robert A. Heinlein, originally serialized in "The Magazine of Fantasy & Science Fiction" (October, November, December 1956, with covers and interior illustrations by Frank Kelly Freas).
turn.4: It was published in hardcover in 1957.
turn.6: The novel is fast-paced hard science fiction, with a key fantastic element and a romantic element.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: In three separate "Locus" magazine readers' polls from 1975 to 1998, it was judged the 36th, 29th, and the 43rd all-time best science-fiction novel.
turn.9: Is there anything else you can share?
turn.10: Its title was triggered by a remark which Heinlein's wife Virginia made when their cat refused to leave the house: "He's looking for a door into summer." Heinlein wrote the novel in 13 days.
turn.12: The novel opens in 1970 with Daniel Boone Davis, an engineer and inventor, well into a long drinking binge.
